meta.title: COVID-19: Wilton Public Schools Novel Coronavirus Disease 2019 Information - Wilton Public Schools

COVID-19: Wilton Public Schools Novel Coronavirus Disease 2019 Information - Wilton Public Schools
COVID-19: Wilton Public Schools Novel Coronavirus Disease 2019 Information - Wilton Public Schools

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasMenu fsHasFooter fsHasOneColumnLayout fsSection3 fsHasTheme2

div.div:
Wilton Public Schools We celebrate our students accomplishments from Pre-K to High School Graduation!
Register Your Child Today

img.alt: A class of Wilton High School Seniors celebrate graduation on the football field by throwing their caps in the air

li.a: COVID-19: Wilton Public Schools Novel Coronavirus Disease 2019 Information
Closing / Delays and Early Dismissal Times

br.span: The Wilton Board of Education is pleased to be the bridge between the community and the schools. The Board of Education is responsible for governing the schools. The six-member board is elected for four-year staggered terms.

div.div:
Wilton's Schools The Wilton School District is comprised of four schools.
Miller-Driscoll (PreK-2nd Grade)
Cider Mill (3rd-5th Grade)
Middlebrook School (6th-8th Grade)
Wilton High School (9th-12th Grade)

img.alt: Arial view of the four Wilton Public Schools

div.div: 2nd Grade Weaving As part of the art curriculum at Miller-Driscoll, Second Graders weave their own designs in yarn.

img.alt: A girl weaves a bright placemat using colorful yarn.

li.a: Access The Speak Up CyberTip Hotline
Learn about Free & Reduced Price Lunch
COVID-19: Wilton Public Schools Novel Coronavirus Disease 2019 Information
Closing / Delays and Early Dismissal Times
Members of the Board of Education

h1.span: Wilton Public Schools Novel Coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19) Information

p.span: This page has been created as a central location for Wilton Public Schools information related to the Novel Coronavirus Disease 2019, also known as COVID-19 and Coronavirus in the public vernacular and in the press.
We will be providing new information as it becomes available.

font.b: Wilton Public Schools Will Be Closed Until Further Notice.
Read The Letter From First Selectwoman Lynne Vanderslice here.

li.a: A Message from the Wilton BOE
3/6/2020: COVID-19 Letter from Wilton Public Schools

h2.a: A Message from the Wilton BOE

p.a: A Message to Families and the Community

a.b: What can you expect from your child’s school counselor during elearning? What can you expect from school psychologists and social workers during elearning?

div.p: Answers to some of your questions can be found on the COVID-19 FAQ Page.

li.a: WPS eLearning Plan for Extended Closure. Posted 3/21/2020
Centers for Disease Control: Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-!9)
The CDC’s guidelines for creating a household plan of action can be found on its website.
New York Times: Talking to Teens and Tweens About Coronavirus
Tips for helping teens and adolescents
National Society of School Psychologists: Talking to Children About COVID-19
NPR: Just For Kids: A Comic Exploring The New Coronavirus
Talking to children about the coronavirus
National Society of School Psychologists: Talking to Children About COVID-19

b.a: Taking Care of Your Emotional Health - CDC

li.b: Got Coronavirus Anxiety? These 5 Tips Can Help You Regain Your Calm - Shots Health News: NPR (3-minute podcast)

li.a: Coping with Corona: Mental health supports in a pandemic

ul.li: Crisis Text Line provides free, 24/7 support via text message. Text HOME to 741741 to connect with a Crisis Counselor.

div.p: Kevin J. Smith, Ph.D., Superintendent of Schools
Wilton Public Schools is committed to a policy of equal opportunity for all qualified persons.

Wilton Public Schools does not discriminate in any employment practice, education program, or educational activity on the basis of race, color, religious creed, sex, age, national origin, ancestry, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability (including, but not limited to, intellectual disability, past or present history of mental disorder, physical disability or learning disability), genetic information & testing, Family & Medical Leave status, protected veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by Connecticut state and/or federal nondiscrimination laws.

Wilton Public Schools prohibits retaliation against individuals who bring forth any complaint, orally or in writing, to the employer or the government, or against any individuals who assist or participate in the investigation of any complaint or otherwise oppose discrimination.
